turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: You've done me a great service.

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: It would have been uncivil of me to have let you make such a long trip for nothing.

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: Is it over if they arrest you now?

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: Not if they arrest me -- or a thousand -- or ten thousand.  It is not only generals who know how to plan campaigns.

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: Are you going to walk all the way?

turns.speaker: WALKER
turns.text: My name is Walk-er. And I intend to report it the way it is.

turns.speaker: MIRABEHN
turns.text: It has. But you'd be surprised. They understand -- they really do. It's not the workers you have to worry about.

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: Good.  Ba will have to teach you to spin too.

turns.speaker: MIRABEHN
turns.text: I would rather march.

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: First spin. Let the others march for a time.

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: Do you find me stubborn?

turns.speaker: MIRABEHN
turns.text: I don't know... I know you are right. I don't know that this is right.

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: I'm sure I'm fit for at least five hundred miles.

turns.speaker: MIRABEHN
turns.text: You should ride the pony. It is not necessary to walk to prove the point.

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: It is foolish if it is just to save the life of an old man.

turns.speaker: MIRABEHN
turns.text: No... no. In every temple and mosque they have pledged to die before they lift a hand against each other.

turns.speaker: JINNAH
turns.text: We hope you intend to join us in the struggle for Home Rule, Mr. Gandhi.

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: The honor is ours. May I introduce Mr. Kallenbach. He's an old friend  and his interest is in flowers. I presumed to tell him he could wander your gardens while we talked.

turns.speaker: JINNAH
turns.text: I'll send my gardener. I'm sure you'll have much to discuss.

turns.speaker: JINNAH
turns.text: You mean a general strike?

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: I mean a day of prayer and fasting. But of course no work could be done -- no buses, no trains, no factories, no administration. The country would stop.

turns.speaker: JINNAH
turns.text: After what they did at the massacre -- it's only an eye for an eye.

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: An eye for an eye only ends up making the whole world blind.  We must stop.

turns.speaker: JINNAH
turns.text: I will not sit by to see the mastery of the British replaced by the mastery of the Hindus!

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: Muslim and Hindu are the right and left eye of India. No one will be slave, no one master.

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: Who is that young man?

turns.speaker: PATEL
turns.text: That's young Nehru. He's got his father's intellect, his mother's looks and the devil's charm. If they don't ruin him at Cambridge -- Wave! Wave! -- he may amount to something.

turns.speaker: PATEL
turns.text: I must say when I first saw you as a bumbling lawyer here in Bombay I never thought I'd be greeting you as a national hero.

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: I'm hardly that, Mr. Patel.

turns.speaker: PATEL
turns.text: Oh, yes, you are. It's been two hundred years since an Indian has cocked a snoot at the British Empire and got away with it. And stop calling me Mr. Patel, you're not a junior clerk anymore.

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: No.

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: I am beginning to know Mr. Nehru.

turns.speaker: PATEL
turns.text: Well, I've called you here because I've had a chance to see the new legislation. It's exactly what was rumored. Arrest without warrant. Automatic imprisonment for possession of materials considered seditious...

turns.speaker: PATEL
turns.text: It must have been the only Non-violent campaign ever led by a man who wanted to kill everybody every day.

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: Not true!  The secret is mastering the urge.

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: They are preparing for war. I will not support it, but I do not intend to take advantage of their danger.

turns.speaker: PATEL
turns.text: That's when you take advantage.

turns.speaker: PATEL
turns.text: We need your help!

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: There is nothing I can give.

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: In England, I was a poor student but I --

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: That was England.

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: You mean you employ Mr. Baker as your attorney, but you can't walk down the street with him?

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: I can. But I risk being kicked into the gutter by someone less "holy" than Mr. Baker.

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: Well, then, it must be fought. We are children of God like everyone else.

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: Allah be praised. And what battalions will you call upon?

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: I -- I will write to the press -- here -- and in England.  And I will use the courts.

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: They're sparing no one, I see.

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: No. You were the surprise. It's been all over the prison. We thought they'd be too afraid of the English press.

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: So did I.

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: I don't know who they've left out there to do the work. There can't be one mine left open. Have they touched the women?

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: My wife publicly defied the law. They've arrested her and four others.

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: The fools!  Sorry...

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: It's split the Government.

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: Well, that's one victory.

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: If we hold firm, it won't be the last.

turns.speaker: KHAN
turns.text: Don't worry -- I've never seen men so determined. You've given them a way to fight... And I don't think --

turns.speaker: SMUTS
turns.text: Will you have a glass of sherry?

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: Thank you. No.

turns.speaker: SMUTS
turns.text: Perhaps some tea?

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: I dined at the prison.

turns.speaker: SMUTS
turns.text: Ahh.

turns.speaker: SMUTS
turns.text: Mr. Gandhi, I've more or less decided to ask the House to repeal the Act that you have taken such "exception" to.

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: Well, if you ask, General Smuts, I'm sure it will be done.

turns.speaker: SMUTS
turns.text: Hm. Of course it is not quite that simple.

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: Somehow I expected not.

turns.speaker: SMUTS
turns.text: I'm glad to hear you say that... very glad. You see if we repeal the Act under pressure  under this kind of pressure it will create a great deal of resentment. Can you understand that?

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: Very well.

turns.speaker: SMUTS
turns.text: Good. Good.  I have thought of calling for a Royal Commission to "investigate" the new legislation.  I think I could guarantee they would recommend the Act be repealed.

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: I congratulate them.

turns.speaker: SMUTS
turns.text: You're an extraordinary man.

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: I assure you I feel a very ordinary man at this moment.

turns.speaker: SMUTS
turns.text: Assuming we are in agreement?

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: Yes -- yes. It's just that... in these clothes I'd -- I'd prefer to go by taxi.

turns.speaker: SMUTS
turns.text: All right. Fine.

turns.speaker: GANDHI
turns.text: I'm -- I'm afraid I have no money.

turns.speaker: SMUTS
turns.text: Oh!  Neither have I.  I'm awfully sorry.

turns.speaker: IRWIN
turns.text: And that's the basis of this "Declaration of Independence"?

turns.speaker: SENIOR POLICE OFFICER
turns.text: Yes, sir. The day he sets off everyone is supposed to raise the flag of "Free India." Then he walks some two hundred and forty miles to the sea and makes salt.

turns.speaker: SENIOR POLICE OFFICER
turns.text: ...There's been no time to keep figures, but there must be ninety -- a hundred thousand under arrest.  And it still goes on.

turns.speaker: IRWIN
turns.text: Who's leading them?

turns.speaker: SENIOR POLICE OFFICER
turns.text: I don't know! Nehru, Patel, almost every Congress Official is in jail... and their wives and their children -- we've even arrested Nehru's mother.

turns.speaker: IRWIN
turns.text: He's addressed this letter directly to you, has he?

turns.speaker: SENIOR POLICE OFFICER
turns.text: Yes, sir, he has. The usual -- India's salt belongs to India -- but then he says flatly that he personally is going to lead a raid tomorrow on the Dharasana Salt Works.

turns.speaker: IRWIN
turns.text: Thank him for his letter, and put him in jail.

turns.speaker: PATEL
turns.text: Ah -- we should invite Gandhi. What the devil has happened to him anyway?

turns.speaker: NEHRU
turns.text: He's "discovering" India.

turns.speaker: NEHRU
turns.text: Have you read his magazine?

turns.speaker: PATEL
turns.text: No -- but I think I'm going to.

turns.speaker: NEHRU
turns.text: Bapu, for me, and the rest,  if that is what you want, we will accept it. But out there  already there is rioting because Hindus fear you are going to give too much away.

turns.speaker: PATEL
turns.text: If you did this, no one could control it. No one.

turns.speaker: NEHRU
turns.text: He was right. It's insane -- anything would have been better.

turns.speaker: PATEL
turns.text: Have you found him?

turns.speaker: NEHRU
turns.text: In Calcutta it's like civil war. The Muslims rose and there was a bloodbath, and now the Hindus are taking revenge -- and if we can't stop it there'll be no hope for the Hindus left in Pakistan.

turns.speaker: PATEL
turns.text: ...an eye for an eye making the whole world blind.

turns.speaker: PATEL
turns.text: Could we cut all news off? I know --

turns.speaker: NEHRU
turns.text: Bapu -- please. Where are you going.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: You almost sound like you believe that.

turns.speaker: ANTON
turns.text: Come with me now, Vincent.  You've gone as far as you can go.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: There are a few million miles to go yet.

turns.speaker: ANTON
turns.text: It's over.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Is that the only way you can succeed, Anton, to see me fail?

turns.speaker: ANTON
turns.text: It's for the best.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: God, even you want to tell me what I can't do. In case you hadn't noticed, Anton, I don't need rescuing. But you did, once.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Well?  You have all the answers.  How is that possible?

turns.speaker: ANTON
turns.text: You didn't beat me that day. I beat myself.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Who are you trying to convince?

turns.speaker: ANTON
turns.text: I will prove it to you.  Come swim with me now, Vincent.  Now--tonight.

turns.speaker: ANTON
turns.text: How are you doing this, Vincent? How have you done any of this?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Now is your chance to find out.

turns.speaker: ANTON
turns.text: Vincent, where's the shore?  We're too far out. We have to go back!

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Too late for that.  We're closer to the other side.

turns.speaker: ANTONIO
turns.text: We were wondering if we should leave some things to chance.

turns.speaker: GENETICIST
turns.text: You want to give your child the best possible start. Believe me, we have enough imperfection built-in already. Your child doesn't need any additional burdens. And keep in mind, this child is still you, simply the best of you. You could conceive naturally a thousand times and never get such a result.

turns.speaker: ANTONIO
turns.text: He's right, Maria.  That's right.

turns.speaker: GENETICIST
turns.text: Is there any reason you'd want a left-handed child?

turns.speaker: ANTONIO
turns.text: Er, no...

turns.speaker: GENETICIST
turns.text: Some believe it is associated with creativity, although there's no evidence.  Also for sports like baseball it can be an advantage.

turns.speaker: ANTONIO
turns.text: I like football.

turns.speaker: GENETICIST
turns.text: I have to warn you, Mr Luca, he's going to be at least a head taller than you. Prepare for a crick in the neck in sixteen years time.

turns.speaker: ANTONIO
turns.text: How much extra?

turns.speaker: GENETICIST
turns.text: It would be five thousand more.

turns.speaker: ANTONIO
turns.text: I'm sorry, there's no way we can.

turns.speaker: GENETICIST
turns.text: Don't worry.  You'll probably do just as well singing to him in the womb.  We can implant the most successful pre-embryo tomorrow afternoon.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: So you've finally seen sense and come back to your old job, Vincent.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Not yet, I'm afraid.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: No?  What's keeping you?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: I guess I'm a slow learner.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: I guess so.  Well, while you're up there, maybe you could tidy the place up a bit.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: I'll see what I can do.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: And don't go getting everybody lost out there. You'll give us a bad name.  You won't have me to keep an eye on you, you know.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: By the way, I left some trash in your locker.

turns.speaker: CAESAR
turns.text: I'll take care of it.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HUGO
turns.text: I don't understand why you were dragged out here, Sir.  It's hardly worth wasting your time--a no-nothing case like this.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: A man's dead, Detective.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HUGO
turns.text: Of course, Sir.  We're checking the entry log, alibis, grudges...

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: Grudges?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HUGO
turns.text: I look around, I see a lot of dry eyes. The Director was not...  ...universally loved.  He was leading the cut-backs in the program.  You're looking at a room full of motives.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: No, this is your man.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HUGO
turns.text: With respect, Sir--it may be the only unaccountable specimen but the profile suggests--

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: --What about his profile?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HUGO
turns.text: According to this, he's a sick man.  Congenital heart condition.  Who knows how long the specimen has been here but there's an 80 percent chance the owner of that eyelash has already died himself from natural causes.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: So there's a 20 percent chance he's not dead.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HUGO
turns.text: Even if this Vincent Luca is alive, is it likely he could bludgeon a man to death?

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: No. Not likely.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HUGO
turns.text: Of course that doesn't jibe with what we found.  This was an angry killing.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: Who knows with these "deficients"?  His profile indicates a proclivity for violence.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HUGO
turns.text: I'll run a crossover on the eyelash for any family or associate connections--

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: --I've already run it.  There's no record of any living relative.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HUGO
turns.text: What a pity.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: Detective Hugo, it's a simple case of lost and found.  All we have to do is locate the man who's minus an eyelash and this murder will solve itself.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: We're in the wrong place.  We're wasting time.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HUGO
turns.text: This is the most likely location--

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: --There's that word again.  I have a feeling This man doesn't play the odds, Detective.  Not exactly a slave to probability.  Is it "likely" that a man who has successfully eluded authorities for fifteen years--a brutal killer--is going to come to us now like a lamb?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HUGO
turns.text: Is there something more we should know about this suspect, Sir?  I mean besides what's on his sheet.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: Since going underground, traces of this In-Valid have shown up at the scene of four serious felonies.  Do you need any more than that?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HUGO
turns.text: With respect, Sir, many perfectly innocent citizens have left specimens at as many crime scenes.  Maybe he's just unlucky.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: I don't like anybody this unlucky. Widen the sweep. The West side. Draw a five mile radius around Gattaca. Hoover some of the classier establishments. Random car stops.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HUGO
turns.text: We're already getting complaints about frivolous search.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: This is a murder investigation.  The public should be happy to co-operate, to get this disease off the streets.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HUGO
turns.text: The skin flake was found in Michael's Restaurant. The employees are all accounted for.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: A customer?  Does this Michael's cater to misfits?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HUGO
turns.text: No.  But one or two "borrowed ladders" have shown up there in the past.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: Of course.  He's a "de-gene-erate".  He works at Gattaca.  Why else would we find the eyelash near the washroom?  Nobody stops to take a leak during a murder.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HUGO
turns.text: It's still possible the eyelash specimen came from a janitor, delivery man--it could have blown in through an open window.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: He was afraid of being exposed.  That's why he did it.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HUGO
turns.text: It is hard to believe he could be one of their elite workers.  You've seen their security system.  They know who works there.  Even if you ignore the man's expiration date, his profile suggests that he doesn't have the mathematical propensity let alone the stamina to pass their physicals.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: Don't underestimate these imposters.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HUGO
turns.text: None of the ID photos match the enhancement.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: A man can change his face--but blood is forever. Sample every employee within the parameters I gave you.  Intravenous.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HUGO
turns.text: You know their workforce.  Two-thirds at least fall into the category.  We'll be closing down their operation for days.  At least go with a fingertip sample or urine.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: Blood.  From the vein.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HUGO
turns.text: That's the last.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: Something's not right.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HUGO
turns.text: He's not here.  It's a blind alley.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: No, we've missed something.  We Hoover again.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HUGO
turns.text: We don't have the manpower.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: Get it.  From outside, if you have to.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HUGO
turns.text: From what budget?

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: I'll take it out of your damn pension if you question my authority one more time!

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: What are you waiting for?

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HUGO
turns.text: Where do we start?

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: We'll vacuum these streets if we have to.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HUGO
turns.text: Positive saliva match.  The cup was definitely used since the original sweep.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: So we have two choices. Either our suspect came back to the murder scene for a drink of water and I don't know anybody that thirsty or... ...he is here. We test again. You're right, Hugo, this was a desperate act. Someone had a lot to lose that night--perhaps their place in line. I'd like the profiles of everyone with an upcoming mission.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HUGO
turns.text: We found his spit in the dead director's eye. He's signed a confession--supplied us with the suit he wore on the night.  What more do you want?

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: Luca could still be an accomplice.

turns.speaker: DETECTIVE HUGO
turns.text: It's not exactly him.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: Where did you get this?

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: How often do you test, Director?

turns.speaker: DIRECTOR JOSEF
turns.text: Often.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: Surely you know what you have.

turns.speaker: DIRECTOR JOSEF
turns.text: We have to be certain.  Once they're up, we can hardly turn the boat around.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: We believe we have a suspect.

turns.speaker: DIRECTOR JOSEF
turns.text: What a relief.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: This unaccountable specimen was found in the south wing corridor.

turns.speaker: DIRECTOR JOSEF
turns.text: Would you care to look--in the telescope?

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: Thank you, no.

turns.speaker: DIRECTOR JOSEF
turns.text: One look through there and you would know why I can't possibly allow you to disrupt operations any further.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: You're so unconcerned that you have a killer in your midst.

turns.speaker: DIRECTOR JOSEF
turns.text: Right now, your presence is creating more of a threat. I don't think you have any concept of what we do here--how meticulous our preparations must be. We are about to send twelve people through 140 million miles of blackness to rendezvous with an object the size of a house and the color of coal. So it's rather critical to point them in the right direction. And we certainly don't need you looking over our shoulders. Besides, I don't believe there is any evidence that the killer is amongst us. I don't see too many other dead bodies littering the place.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: No, but since there aren't too many live ones tonight either, you won't mind us conducting one further sweep. If he does not work here, then there should be no other trace of him. I think you'd better get some people out of bed, Detective. In the meantime we can re-check his favorite haunt.

turns.speaker: DIRECTOR JOSEF
turns.text: Twelve have a mission within the week.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: This time I will supervise each test personally.

turns.speaker: INVESTIGATOR
turns.text: At least it's nothing contagious.

turns.speaker: DIRECTOR JOSEF
turns.text: I will not permit any further testing on the eve of a mission.  We're already counting backwards.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: Hello.

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: Jerome--?

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: Hello, sweatheart.  Come on up.

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: Good to see you're feeling better.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: Now you're here. Who are your "friends"?

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: It's about the Director.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: Again?

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: That's where we get rid of the traces of him although we never truly succeeded.

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: I've been looking for him.  Do you know where he is?

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: He's probably leaving some more of me around the place before he goes.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: Don't be deceived, Irene.  These are just the clothes.  He has to wear them. Something I could never do.

turns.speaker: IRENE
turns.text: What's wrong with him?

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: You have more in common than you know.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Okay, how tall did you used to be?

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: Six one.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: He's too tall.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: You okay, Jerome?

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: Yeah.  You want to go dancing tonight?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: What's wrong with it?

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: I think I'd better choose the menu. After all, you're learning how to be me, I'm not learning how to be you.

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: Suit yourself.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: Listen, I don't want you to think I'm ungrateful --I know you and that little broker--what do you call him?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: German.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: You're both going to a lot of trouble-- Maybe you can con somebody into believing you're me to get your foot in the door--but once you're inside, you're on your own. I'm sure you're sincere... ...but I was being groomed for something like this myself. Even without the accident I don't think I would have made it. My point is--how the hell do you expect to pull this off?

turns.speaker: VINCENT
turns.text: I don't know exactly, Jerome.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: At least you're honest.  Call me by my middle name--Eugene--If you're going to be Jerome, you may as well start getting used to it.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: I have to know where you come from.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: If anybody asks, tell them the truth-- your family disowns you.  You are a disappointment, Jerome.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: What about this?

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: Wrong color.  It's silver.  It's not easy living up to this.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: It needs work.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: You had to be a right-hander.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: Noone orders southpaws anymore.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: You really need that much?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: More than that. You'll get used to it.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: God, what wouldn't you do to leave the planet?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Leave?  Just a few million years ago every atom in this hair--in our bodies--was a part of a star. I don't see it as leaving.  I see it as going home.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: God, you're serious, aren't you?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: It's not too late to back out.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: You don't know what a relief it is not to be me. Are you sure you want the job?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: What about you?  What's in this for you, Eugene?

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: Listen, I bag this stuff anyway.  It may as well pay my rent.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: Who died?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: The Mission Director.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: You wish.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: They found him in his office this morning-- beaten so bad they had to check his nametag.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: What an act of benevolence--a service to the community.  So that's it.  Now there's nothing between you and ignition.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: He was still warm when they confirmed.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: This calls for a celebration.  Doesn't it?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: The place is crawling with Hoovers.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: So what?  You didn't kill him, did you?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: That's not the point.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: Hey, how much of you can be there?  Even if the "J. Edgars" do find something, in a week--  you'll be slightly out of their jurisdiction.  Come on, we've got to get drunk immediately.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: You're going to have to earn your supper.  I've got my final physical tomorrow.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Let's get out of here.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: You're right, there's more atmosphere where you're going.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: I gotta stop!!  I gotta stop!!

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Keep going!!  Keep going!!

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: At least up there your piss will be worth something.  You'll all be showering in it, right?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: And drinking it.  It's like Evian by the time it's filtered.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: What is that one?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: 11.15 to the port.  A maintenance crew.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: How long do you stay up there before you go?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: A day or so.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: I still can't believe they're sending you to the Belt--you of all people--never meant to be born, on a mission to discover the origin of life.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Up there they wouldn't be a problem.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: You know I'm scared of heights.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I'm sorry.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: It's okay, Eugene.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: You know I wasn't drunk--I knew what I was doing when I walked in front of that car--

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: --What car?--Go to sleep.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: --I walked right in front of it.  I was never more sober in my life.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: It's all right.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: I'm proud of you, Vincent.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Call German.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: Any particular reason?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: We can't stay here.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: What are you talking about?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: They think I offed the Director.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: What makes them think that?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: They found my eyelash.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: Where?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: In a corridor.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: Could be worse.  They could have found it in your eye.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Come on--we're taking off.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: I'm not going anywhere.  Less than a week to go. Not on your life--

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: --You don't understand, they'll make the connection, they'll hoover again.  We should cut our losses.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: Where is your head, Jerome?  You're acting like a guilty man.  They won't marry the eyelash to you.  They won't believe that one of their elite navigators could have suckered them for the last five years.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: They'll recognize me.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: How could they recognize you? I don't recognize you. Anyway, you don't have a choice. You run, you may as well sign a confession, turn us both in right now. No, we stick this out-- find out what we can but change nothing. This is a minor inconvenience is all it is. We've taken worse heat than this. Jesus, if I'd known you were going to go belly up on me at the last fucking gasp, I wouldn't have bothered. You can't quit on me now. I've put too much into this. Besides, this stuff is mine. I had other offers, you know. I could have rented myself out to somebody with a spine. You want me to wheel in there and finish the job myself? We'll take off all right, from pad 18 just like we planned.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: And keep your lashes on your lids where they belong.  How could you be so careless?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: I'm sorry.  I think I was crying.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: You really had other offers?

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: I'm sure I could have.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: So it's not just the Hoovers who've got you rattled.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: You're the one who said not to change anything. She's my ear to the investigation.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: Is that all?

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: I've got enough on my mind without that.

turns.speaker: EUGENE
turns.text: If you say so.  The stripe.

turns.speaker: JEROME
turns.text: Good choice.
